definition: white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: The primitive and uncivilized nature of my life made me feel like a giant reptile during the Cretaceous or Jurassic periods.
sentences.chinese: 其荒莽无文，恍若白垩纪侏罗纪的一只大爬虫。

sentences.english: From the view of strati graphy they all belong to the cretaceous period.
sentences.chinese: 从地层学上看，它们都属于白垩纪。

sentences.english: From the Cretaceous Period to the Cenozoic Period, the volcanism was mainly related to the rifting;
sentences.chinese: 从白垩纪至新生代，火山作用主要与裂谷作用有关。

sentences.english: The Cretaceous Period was about 120 million years ago.
sentences.chinese: 白垩纪时代大约是一千二百万年以前。

sentences.english: They date back some 98 million years to the mid-Cretaceous period.
sentences.chinese: 这些恐龙是9800万年前中白垩纪时期的动物。

sentences.english: Xixia ruins belong to the Cretaceous period dinosaur rift sedimentary basin.
sentences.chinese: 西峡恐龙遗址属于白垩纪断陷盆地沉积。

sentences.english: From the view of stratigraphy, they all belong to the Cretaceous period.
sentences.chinese: 从地层学上看，它们都属于白垩纪。

sentences.english: The prototype of Zhoukou Cretaceous basin should be of foredeep basin.
sentences.chinese: 白垩纪周口盆地的盆地原型应是山前凹陷盆地。

sentences.english: From the Cretaceous to Tertiary, fault sealing built up with thickening of the overlying strata.
sentences.chinese: 白垩纪至第三纪，随上覆地层增厚，断层封闭性增强。

sentences.english: At the same time, and points out that the lake of Cretaceous is open-type fresh water lake.
sentences.chinese: 同时指出白垩纪湖泊为开放型淡水湖。

definition: Paleozoic, geological era 545-250m years ago, covering Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪, Ordovician 奧陶紀|奥陶纪, Silurian 志留紀|志留纪, Devonian 泥盆紀|泥盆纪, Carboniferous 石炭紀|石炭纪, Permian 二疊紀|二叠纪
Pleistocene (geological epoch from 2m years ago, covering the most recent ice ages)
third period/tertiary (geological era since the extinction of the dinosaurs at the Cretaceous-Tertiary boundary 65 million years ago)
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
pre-Cambrian, geological period before c. 540m years ago
